titleInfo.title: Spanish Town Mardi Gras photographs, circa 1970s.

mods.abstract: The Spanish Town Mardi Gras Parade began in 1981 and traditionally features bawdy or politically-themed floats that reference current events. These photographs were taken by Thomas W. Chandler for his 1985 LSU landscape architecture thesis, in which he surveyed and analyzed Spanish Town. Located between the State Capitol and Interstate 110 and bounded on the north and south by State Capitol Drive and Main St., respectively, Spanish Town is considered the oldest neighborhood in Baton Rouge. It was commissioned in 1805 as a settlement for Canary Islanders when Baton Rouge was still held by the Spanish . In the 20th and 21st-centuries, it has been known for its socio-economic diversity and sense of community.

titleInfo.title: Mardi Gras Mambo: Selections from LSU Libraries Special Collections

mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright of the original material is retained in accordance with U.S. copyright laws. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Division, Louisiana State University Libraries.
Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
mods.note: Thomas W. Chandler Papers, Mss. 3956, Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Collections, LSU Libraries, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
